page.title: 09Farmer's Mart/Longtown.
page.content: In 1926 some farmers from both sides of the border decided to start an Auction Mart to sell the numbers of Fat Cattle and Fat Sheep produced in the Longtown and Border Area.The Cumberland and Dumfriesshire Auction Mart Ltd.was the name given as the Board of Directors came from both counties.From small beginnings the Mart has expanded by being able to acquire the land from the road bridge out of Longton to Smalmstown on the Gretna Rd,including the ponds. The numbers of livestock for sale has increased as farming methods have altered,resulting in 300,000 sheep and 20,000 cattle passing through the auction annually.In order to cope with these numbers new premises have been built comprising offices,restaurant, and selling ring,with extensive stock holding pens.
